intro: Baeothryon nanum, commonly known as the dwarf snowbell, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features delicate, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early summer, often in clusters at the top of its slender stems. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, with a slightly spicy scent. Baeothryon nanum thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
